snippet: Jets fans’ chanting for a switch was a new experience for both quarterbacks — for Smith, the 23-year-old starter, and for Vick, the 34-year-old star turned outcast turned backup.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column observes that New York Jets fans chanting for a quarterback switch was a new experience for both Geno Smith, the starter, and for Michael Vick, star turned outcast turned backup; holds fans attend games to be entertained, and part of that experience is booing starting quarterback when he falters miserably.
lead_paragraph: Jets fans’ chanting for a switch was a new experience for both quarterbacks — for Smith, the 23-year-old starter, and for Vick, the 34-year-old star turned outcast turned backup.

headline.main: Geno Smith and Michael Vick on Opposite Ends of Chant
headline.print_headline: Smith and Vick on Opposite Ends of Chant
